name: Roasted Eggplant Salad
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
method: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F. Prick the eggplants all over with a fork and place them on a baking sheet. Roast until the skin is charred and the flesh is very tender, about 40 minutes. When the eggplants are cool enough to handle, peel off the skin and chop the flesh into bite-sized pieces. In a large bowl, combine the eggplant, red pepper, onion, parsley, and mint. In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, vinegar, cumin, and salt and pepper to taste. Drizzle the dressing over the salad and toss to combine. Serve at room temperature or chilled.

name: Lentil and Mushroom Moussaka
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
method: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. In a large pot, cook the lentils in salted water until tender, about 20-25 minutes. Drain and set aside. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic and sauté until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the mushrooms, oregano, and tomato paste and cook until the mushrooms are tender and the liquid has evaporated, about 10-12 minutes. Stir in the wine and broth and bring to a simmer. Cook until the sauce has thickened, about 10 minutes. In a small bowl, whisk together the egg and Parmesan cheese. Season with salt and pepper. In a greased baking dish, layer the lentils and mushroom mixture. Pour the egg and cheese mixture over the top. Bake for 35-40 minutes, or until the top is golden brown and the dish is hot and bubbly.

name: Grilled Swordfish with Lemon and Garlic
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
method: Preheat a grill to high heat. In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, garlic, lemon juice, lemon zest, red pepper flakes, salt, and pepper. Brush the swordfish steaks with the marinade and let sit for 10-15 minutes. Grill the swordfish for 5-7 minutes per side, or until cooked through. Serve hot with additional lemon wedges and a drizzle of olive oil.

name: Lamb Tagine with Apricots and Almonds
ingredients: 1 1/2 lbs. boneless lamb shoulder, cut into 1 1/2-inch pieces
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
method: Preheat the oven to 325°F. In a large Dutch oven or oven-safe pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the lamb and cook until browned on all sides, about 8 minutes. Remove the lamb from the pot and set aside. Add the onion to the pot and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic, cumin, coriander, cinnamon, allspice, and ginger and cook for another minute, stirring constantly. Add the chicken broth and bring to a boil. Return the lamb to the pot and add the chopped apricots. Cover the pot with a tight-fitting lid and transfer to the oven. Cook for 1 1/2 to 2 hours, or until the lamb is tender. Remove from the oven and season with salt and pepper to taste. Sprinkle with sliced almonds before serving.

name: Greek Moussaka
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
method: Preheat the oven to 375°F. Brush the eggplant slices with olive oil and place them in a single layer on baking sheets. Roast in the oven for 20-25 minutes, or until tender and lightly browned. While the eggplant is roasting, heat the remaining olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the ground lamb and cook until browned, breaking it up with a wooden spoon. Add the onion and garlic to the skillet and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the cinnamon, allspice, diced tomatoes, red wine, salt, and pepper. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 20-25 minutes. In a separate saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Whisk in the flour and cook for 1-2 minutes. Gradually whisk in the milk and nutmeg, stirring constantly, until the mixture thickens. Remove the saucepan from the heat and whisk in the beaten eggs. In a greased 9x13-inch baking dish, layer the roasted eggplant slices and the lamb mixture, starting and ending with the eggplant.  Pour the sauce over the top and sprinkle with grated Parmesan cheese. ke for 45-50 minutes, or until golden brown and bubbly. Let cool for a few minutes before serving.

name: Shakshuka
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
method: Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and bell peppers and cook until softened, about 10 minutes. Add the garlic, cumin, paprika, and cayenne pepper and cook for 1-2 minutes. Add the crushed tomatoes and season with salt and pepper. Simmer for 10-15 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened. Use a spoon to make 6 wells in the sauce. Crack an egg into each well. Cover the skillet and cook until the egg whites are set and the yolks are cooked to your liking, about 5-7 minutes for runny yolks and 8-10 minutes for fully set yolks. Sprinkle with chopped parsley and cilantro and serve with crusty bread for dipping.

name: Moussaka
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
method: Preheat the oven to 400°F. Arrange the eggplant slices in a single layer on baking sheets and brush with olive oil. Roast for 20-25 minutes, or until softened and lightly browned. Meanwhile, heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the ground lamb and cook, breaking it up with a spoon, until browned and cooked through, about 8-10 minutes. Add the onion and garlic to the skillet and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Stir in the tomato paste, cinnamon, oregano, and allspice and cook for 1-2 minutes. Add the diced tomatoes and chicken broth and bring to a simmer. Season with salt and pepper to taste. In a separate saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Whisk in the flour and cook for 1-2 minutes. Gradually whisk in the milk and cook, whisking constantly, until the sauce has thickened. Remove the saucepan from the heat and whisk in the beaten eggs and nutmeg. To assemble the moussaka, spread a layer of the lamb mixture in the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish. Top with a layer of roasted eggplant slices. Repeat the layers until all of the ingredients are used up, ending with a layer of lamb mixture. Pour the egg mixture over the top of the lamb mixture and sprinkle with grated Parmesan cheese. Bake for 40-45 minutes, or until the top is golden brown and the moussaka is hot and bubbly. Let cool for 10-15 minutes before slicing and serving.

name: Grilled Lemon-Herb Chicken
method: Preheat grill to medium-high heat. In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice, oregano, parsley, garlic, salt, and pepper. Place the chicken breasts in a large resealable plastic bag and pour the marinade over the top. Seal the bag and toss to coat the chicken. Place the bag in the refrigerator and marinate for at least 30 minutes, or up to 8 hours. Remove the chicken from the marinade and discard any excess marinade. Grill the chicken for 6-7 minutes per side, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F. Let the chicken rest for 5 minutes before slicing and serving with lemon wedges.

name: Mediterranean Stuffed Peppers
method: Preheat oven to 375°F. Cut off the tops of the bell peppers and remove the seeds and membranes. In a large bowl, combine the cooked brown rice, chickpeas, feta cheese, parsley, mint, oregano, garlic, salt, pepper, and olive oil. Spoon the rice mixture into the bell peppers and place them in a baking dish. Bake for 35-40 minutes, or until the peppers are tender and the filling is heated through. Serve with lemon wedges.

name: Greek Lemon Chicken
method: In a large bowl, whisk together the lemon juice, olive oil, garlic, oregano, salt, and pepper. Add the chicken breasts to the bowl and turn to coat in the marinade. Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes, or up to 2 hours. Preheat the oven to 400°F. Remove the chicken from the marinade and place it in a baking dish. Pour the chicken broth over the chicken. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the juices run clear. Sprinkle the chopped parsley over the chicken and serve with lemon wedges.

name: Grilled Eggplant Salad
ingredients: 1/4 cup olive oil, plus more for brushing
method: Preheat a grill to medium-high heat. Brush the eggplant slices with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Grill the eggplant slices for 3-4 minutes per side, until tender and lightly charred. In a small bowl, whisk together the red wine vinegar, minced garlic, salt, and pepper. Slowly whisk in the 1/4 cup of olive oil. In a large bowl, toss together the chopped tomatoes, sliced red onion, and grilled eggplant slices. Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to coat. Sprinkle the chopped parsley and crumbled feta cheese over the top of the salad before serving.

name: Tzatziki
method: In a medium bowl, stir together the Greek yogurt, grated cucumber, minced garlic, lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and black pepper. Fold in the chopped fresh dill. Cover and chill the tzatziki for at least 1 hour before serving. Serve with warm pita bread.

name: Baba Ghanoush
method: Preheat the oven to 400°F. Place the eggplants on a baking sheet and roast until the skins are charred and the flesh is soft, about 45 minutes. Let the eggplants cool slightly, then cut them in half and scoop out the flesh. Place the eggplant flesh in a food processor along with the tahini, lemon juice, garlic, cumin, smoked paprika, and salt. Process until smooth. Stir in the chopped fresh parsley. Cover and chill the baba ghanoush for at least 1 hour before serving. Serve with warm pita bread.

name: Shakshuka
ingredients: Salt and black pepper, to taste
method: Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and red bell pepper and cook for 5 more minutes. Add the diced tomatoes, smoked paprika, cumin, cayenne pepper, salt, and black pepper. Stir to combine. Bring the mixture to a simmer and cook until slightly thickened, about 10-15 minutes. Crack the eggs into the tomato mixture, making sure to space them out evenly. Cover the skillet and cook until the eggs are set, about 5-7 minutes. Sprinkle the chopped fresh parsley over the top of the shakshuka. Serve the shakshuka with crusty bread for dipping.

name: Fattoush Salad
method: Preheat oven to 350°F. Spread pita pieces on a baking sheet and toss with olive oil, sumac, salt, and black pepper. Bake for 10-12 minutes until crisp. In a large bowl, combine chopped lettuce, diced cucumber, diced tomatoes, sliced red onion, chopped parsley, chopped mint, and chopped cilantro. In a small bowl, whisk together extra-virgin olive oil, fresh lemon juice, and minced garlic. Drizzle the dressing over the salad and toss to combine. Add the baked pita chips to the salad and toss gently. Serve the fattoush salad immediately.

name: Lamb Kofta
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
method: Preheat grill to medium-high heat. In a large bowl, combine the ground lamb, chopped onion, chopped parsley, minced garlic, ground cumin, paprika, ground cinnamon, and salt and pepper to taste. Mix the ingredients together until well combined, then shape the mixture into 8 oblong-shaped patties, each about 3 inches long. Brush the patties with olive oil. Grill the lamb kofta patties for about 3-4 minutes per side, until browned and cooked through. Serve the lamb kofta with tzatziki and pita bread for dipping.

name: Moroccan Chicken Tagine
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
method: In a large dutch oven or tagine, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the chicken thighs and cook until browned on both sides, about 5-7 minutes per side. Remove the chicken from the pot and set aside. Add the chopped onion to the pot and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the minced garlic and grated ginger to the pot and cook for 1-2 minutes. Add the drained diced tomatoes, ground cumin, ground coriander, ground cinnamon, ground turmeric, ground cardamom, and cayenne pepper to the pot. Stir to combine. Return the chicken to the pot, nestling it into the tomato and onion mixture. Add the chicken broth to the pot, cover, and simmer for 30 minutes. Add the pitted green olives, golden raisins, and honey to the pot. Stir to combine and simmer for an additional 10 minutes. Sprinkle the fresh cilantro over the top of the dish before serving.

name: Karniyarik
method: Preheat oven to 375°F.
Slice eggplants lengthwise and scoop out the flesh, leaving about 1/4 inch of flesh on the skin.
Season the eggplants with salt and pepper and place them on a baking dish.
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat.
Add onions and cook until softened.
Add ground beef and garlic and cook until browned.
Add diced tomatoes, tomato paste, parsley, dill, salt, and black pepper. Cook for 5-7 minutes.
Stuff the eggplants with the beef mixture and bake in the oven for 30-40 minutes.
Serve hot with rice or bread.
